AFF9AE03657E472AA713453AC587C6DB.description: describe various strategies and tools that helped them communicate their intended message when publishing and presenting texts, and suggest steps for future improvement as a text creator

BCFD82ACEDAB4BDFB4DE643206832299.description: publish and present texts they have created, using selected media and tools, and explain how each helped them communicate their intended message

AF6B7BDBE9304E59A2789F0331835E13.description: produce final texts using a variety of techniques and tools, including digital design and production tools, to achieve the intended effect

B6AACE6051564FD49B05D482F5AE8CAE.description: Publishing, Presenting, and Reflecting" select suitable and effective media, techniques, and tools to publish and present final texts, and critically analyze how well the texts address various

55EDC1EDE33648A48423005D461853B2.description: edit draft texts to improve accuracy and style, checking for errors in spelling, punctuation, grammar, and format; use a word processor to edit texts

25549710F9FB44CB832DE17EEEBDFA9E.description: make revisions to the content of draft texts and to elements of style, such as word choice, and add or delete sentences, to improve clarity, focus, and coherence, seeking feedback

8708A3BD016242F884C0F5309F6BAA5D.description: identify the point of view, implicit and explicit perspectives, and bias conveyed in their texts, and explain how their messages might be interpreted by audiences with different perspectives

6F7E82E052EC41E387C39120CC36E68E.description: establish a personal voice in their texts, using varied language and elements of style to express their thoughts, feelings, and opinions about a topic, and using a tone appropriate to the form and genre

A3202E713A8242838C2182A900A1465C.description: write in fluent cursive, begin to keyboard with automaticity, and apply word-processing skills, including selecting appropriate fonts, to produce and enhance texts of various lengths

5071CE3FD91C4F9BAF3DC70D075A74AD.description: draft texts of various forms and genres, including narrative, persuasive, and informational texts, using a variety of media, tools, and strategies

54272738850340E78129B83BD82F4B83.description: Creating Texts: apply knowledge and understanding of various text forms and genres to create, revise, edit, and proofread their own texts, using a variety of media, tools, and strategies, and reflect critically on created texts

CBACE84D35FB4E37950D6FDA6AD2A2F1.description: describe the strategies and tools that helped them develop ideas and organize content for texts of the chosen forms, genres, and media, and explain how they helped them improve as a text creator

1D56916853AD4612963A872734FB45BD.description: select and classify ideas and collected information, using appropriate strategies and tools, and sequence content, taking into account the chosen text form, genre, and medium

93C8D655128143EBBC2B8DEAEAEEA594.description: gather and record information and content relevant to a topic, using multiple textual sources; verify the reliability of sources, using simple criteria; and record the creator and source of all content created by others

B1C14A393D024CAA8541942A9925EA21.description: generate and develop ideas and details about various topics, such as topics related to diversity, equity, and inclusion and to other subject areas, using a variety of strategies, and drawing on various resources, including their own lived experiences

AE1D8435E5884EE5934FF719690A7F9F.description: identify the topic, purpose, and audience for various texts they plan to create, and explain why the chosen text form, genre, and medium suit the purpose and audience and how they will help communicate the intended meaning

3878E9AD2E584D8A80311F03856897E7.description: Developing Ideas and Organizing Content: plan, develop ideas, gather information, and organize content for creating texts of various forms, including digital and media texts, on a variety of topics

8CF4475689B94A58963A0EA14B7CC7F2.description: Composition: Expressing Ideas and Creating Texts

20FBC10351B347DCA12DCE2D3F0155AA.description: identify the critical thinking skills they used to analyze and evaluate various texts, and explain how these skills have helped them better understand the texts

CBEE8D5784504021BDAD168EAD80BC37.description: explain how texts created by First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, or nations are influenced by historical periods, cultural experiences, and events, and how they relate to current lived experiences

E2AD4B34C3754396832348C9722749E6.description: explain how various topics, such as diversity, inclusion, and accessibility, are addressed in texts, and describe what insights or messages are conveyed

5EF1BD9640474705B56CE18A02C537EF.description: identify explicit and implicit perspectives communicated in various texts, explain how these perspectives are conveyed, give some evidence of any biases the texts may contain, and suggest how such biases could influence an audience

6FEA8C98F18E47B492EED406ADEBAB3C.description: identify cultural elements that are represented in various texts, including, norms, values, artifacts, sports, and music, investigate the meanings of these elements, and make connections to their lived experience and culture

676ABB253F8C4B899BA0C5984EDCE8F4.description: analyze various texts, including literary and informational texts, by identifying main and supporting ideas, sequencing the events of multiple plots, recording relevant information, and explaining cause and effect

B104D694D935411B802B261C54D948BE.description: make local and global inferences, using explicit and implicit evidence, to extend their understanding of various texts

EA29A4016ADF42178AFB6EA33942FC3E.description: describe literary devices, including imagery and humour, in a variety of texts, and explain how they help create meaning and are appropriate for the intended purpose and audience

DAEB8B2BBBF1492194554ABB38AECA87.description: Critical Thinking in Literacy: apply critical thinking skills to deepen understanding of texts, and analyze how various perspectives and topics are communicated and addressed in a variety of texts, including digital, media, and cultural texts

0DDFABCCCFE6404DBC1D7C6796B0FA06.description: explain how strategies such as visualizing, making predictions, summarizing, and connecting to their experiences have helped them comprehend various texts

2952DE815E314657A7070A72CEC40A4D.description: summarize the main idea of a text and the supporting details in sequence, and draw a well-supported conclusion

0DD136D010BC41A0A5045E2679CEE56D.description: describe how the ideas expressed in texts connect to their knowledges and lived experiences, the ideas in other texts, and the world around them

49E40543500D4F8AB4EA885C9743441C.description: use strategies such as adjusting reading rate, visualizing, reading ahead, asking questions, and consulting references and other texts or sources of information, to monitor and confirm their understanding of various texts

F06DE6606A5849D5B65D3F39A0E87D06.description: make predictions using background knowledge, text features, and evidence from the text, and pose questions to check whether their predictions were correct

90B4E17142964323B7E1CD4C09476542.description: identify a variety of purposes for engaging with texts, and select texts from diverse creators that are suitable for the purposes

6CB41296FC00405C934335A77952D0F4.description: identify and explain prior knowledge from various sources, including personal experiences, that they can use to make connections and understand new texts

8EA8EC365FA94A80B9E4F6209518B563.description: Comprehension Strategies: apply comprehension strategies before, during, and after reading, listening to, and viewing a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, in order to understand and clarify the meaning of texts

4EFC962DE6AC499E9EE3E4FCFDB3E011.description: read, listen to, and view various forms of texts by diverse First Nations, Métis, and Inuit creators to make meaning through Indigenous Storywork about First Nations, Métis, and Inuit histories, cultures, relationships, communities, groups, nations, and lived experiences

EC8BFE4A569B418C9CA841648E7981EA.description: identify the narrator’s point of view, including first, second, or third person, in a variety of texts, and describe the advantages and disadvantages of the approach used in each story

F65CB5EB55FA4E2088E0725403211A76.description: describe various elements of style in texts, including voice, word choice, word patterns, and sentence structure, and analyze how each element helps create meaning and is appropriate for the text form and genre

0B861F81CEEA4DFC9DAAF1DB491FE4A6.description: explain how images, graphics, and visual design create, communicate, and contribute to meaning in a variety of texts

9722AA8493E7482BB0EEC72A247B0E0C.description: identify text patterns, such as cause and effect in a persuasive text, and text features, such as a preface and glossary, associated with various text forms, including cultural texts, and explain how they help readers, listeners, and viewers understand the meaning

9D9AA62475EC4965B6E17EA5F30F3754.description: describe some characteristics of various text forms and genres, including cultural text forms, and explain how they help communicate meaning

D1D5BC1B0903460CBDEDE345372A2C26.description: read and comprehend various texts, using knowledge of words, grammar, cohesive ties, sentence structures, and background knowledge

317AFAE9184A4C7D805F07036F4B7CFF.description: Knowledge about Texts: apply foundational knowledge and skills to understand a variety of texts, including digital and media texts, by creators with diverse identities, perspectives, and experience, and demonstrate an understanding of the patterns, features, and elements of style associated with various text forms and genres

9CD023A16F354AE4836CF59F84CCB71C.description: Comprehension: Understanding and Responding to Texts

8EB33B7D2C27441BB2819346A8500B72.description: use their understanding of the meaning and function of capitalization and punctuation to communicate meaning clearly and coherently, including the use of commas to set off advanced phrases or clauses such as appositives and participles, and colons for introducing a list after a complete sentence

CD5C7C295CA94EC887D5DFE41B45E34B.description: demonstrate an understanding of the functions of parts of speech in sentences, including direct objects for nouns, intensive and reflexive pronouns, proper adjectives, and correlative conjunctions, and use this knowledge to support comprehension and communicate meaning clearly

E4B51676DFA94A4EA781DD9E579612A7.description: identify and construct various sentence types and forms, including compound-complex sentences, and correct sentence fragments and run-on sentences

77EBF77D9F994D46ACC41025D3439418.description: Language Conventions for Reading and Writing: demonstrate an understanding of sentence structure, grammar, cohesive ties, and capitalization and punctuation, and apply this knowledge when reading and writing sentences, paragraphs, and a variety of texts

64686B6EA35541BC83CE53DA9D9E779D.description: read a variety of texts fluently, with accuracy and appropriate pacing to support comprehension, and when reading aloud, adjust expression and intonation according to the purpose of reading

630FFBE0B49841569AEB77022EBDFE9B.description: demonstrate an understanding of a variety of words, acquire and use explicitly taught vocabulary in various contexts, including other subject areas, and use generalized morphological knowledge to analyze and understand new words in context

A9D9936781EE413D88A6FB5AC3EB082E.description: use generalized knowledge of the meanings of words and morphemes (i.e., bases, prefixes, and suffixes) to read and spell words with accuracy and automaticity

7CFFA5D0B28449CAAD572CE57355CC30.description: Language Foundations for Reading and Writing: demonstrate an understanding of foundational language knowledge and skills, and apply this understanding when reading and writing

33C49EB9EDDA456DA27C7776BEB25A1F.description: use appropriate word choice, including new vocabulary, varied adjectives and adverbs to elaborate, a variety of sentence types, and cohesive sentences during formal and informal communication, to support audience comprehension

5A1968D94C1D4011BFF66D6AA8455E81.description: identify and use oral and non-verbal communication strategies, including expression, gestures, and body language, and explain how these strategies help them understand or communicate ideas and meaning

010BEC39FDCB4223938B035E2D674FEC.description: identify the purpose and audience for speaking in formal and informal contexts, and use appropriate speaking strategies, including paraphrasing and restating, to communicate clearly and coherently

4DE436CEDD15485EA6340EFD0B6DF42D.description: select and use a variety of listening strategies before, during, and after listening to comprehend information and messages communicated orally and non-verbally, determine the purpose of a text, construct meaning, seek clarification, and develop an appropriate response

C54F9C194ED64860917405B74F43693A.description: use effective listening skills, including expressing interest in what is being said at appropriate times, asking questions to encourage a speaker to elaborate, and responding to the contributions of others in group discussions, in formal and informal contexts and for various purposes

9E87162D81AB48E395ABC0AAF1B597E8.description: Oral and Non-Verbal Communication: apply listening, speaking, and non-verbal communication skills and strategies to understand and communicate meaning in formal and informal contexts and for various purposes and audiences

2DE438E31B8B4CB680ADA08562D5023B.description: explain themes explored in First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultures to demonstrate an understanding of the varied identities, perspectives, relationships, legacies, truths, and ways of knowing, being, and doing

CE4896F25EFB44CB8238A8E398242049.description: demonstrate an understanding of the historical contexts, contributions, lived experiences, and perspectives of a diversity of individuals and communities, including those in Canada, by exploring the concepts of identity, self, and sense of belonging in a variety of culturally responsive and relevant texts

19974BF5EE8B4D5CAEBF892B4B39848B.description: explain how the knowledge and skills developed in this grade support learning in various subject areas and in everyday life, and describe how they enhance understanding and communication

E71B8BC3C88348C6B594D280AC4FDA44.description: Applications, Connections, and Contributions" apply language and literacy skills in cross-curricular and integrated learning, and demonstrate an understanding of, and make connections to, diverse voices, experiences, perspectives, histories, and contributions, including those of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, groups, and nations

4227F55E900949EBA5DFAA52154D30C5.description: communicate and collaborate with various communities in a safe, respectful, responsible, and inclusive manner when using online platforms and environments, including digital and media tools, and demonstrate cultural awareness with members of the community

589D478B77644F5397E359675291641A.description: select and use appropriate digital and media tools to support the design process and address authentic, relevant, real-world problems by developing innovative solutions

D68A5A9A9FFC4A79BD7E7042A3F41F73.description: demonstrate an understanding of the interrelationships between the form, message, and context of texts, the intended audience, and the purpose for production

DC33F1086EA7486E9DC83054E9203864.description: demonstrate an understanding of the forms, conventions, and techniques of digital and media texts, consider the impact on the audience, and apply this understanding when analyzing and creating texts

D356D4E2606F442284408FE6779A58CA.description: gather, evaluate, and use information, considering validity, credibility, accuracy, and perspectives, to construct knowledge, create texts, and demonstrate learning

4F15AD4E35814D279E4C290B0744BEC7.description: demonstrate an understanding of how to navigate online environments safely, manage their privacy and personal data, and interact in a way that supports their well-being and that of others, including seeking appropriate permission

4767EB658B3144DDA702731BC671A4F1.description: explain their rights and responsibilities when interacting online with appropriate permission, and make decisions that contribute positively to the development of their digital identity and those of their communities

D7D181C100104B5BA525E15258337269.description: Digital Media Literacy: demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills needed to interact safely and responsibly in online environments, use digital and media tools to construct knowledge, and demonstrate learning as critical consumers and creators of media

299B0961EF4B41159896D6A8074BB882.description: explain how transferable skills help them to express their voice, be engaged in their learning, and plan the next steps to develop their capabilities and potential

83D1E1D420CE4E34B07235907FB9DDC2.description: explain how transferable skills can be used to support communication in various cultural, social, linguistic, and domain-specific contexts, and apply them when reading, listening to, viewing, and creating texts of various forms

6AFF4078BAD649F9BB12FAD3A873CA48.description: Transferable Skills: demonstrate an understanding of how the seven transferable skills (critical thinking and problem solving; innovation, creativity, and entrepreneurship; self-directed learning; collaboration; communication; global citizenship and sustainability; and digital literacy) are used in various language and literacy contexts
